meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'vali', referring to a unit of currency in Estonia.
meanings.sent1: In Estonia, you can use valis to buy goods and services.
meanings.sent2: The valis in Estonia is called the kroon.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally paid with valis instead of euros, and the cashier was confused.
meanings.sent4: Her generosity was like a shower of valis, spreading happiness everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The shiny valis jingled in his pocket, a reminder of his trip to Estonia.

meanings.sent1: Archaeologists found a collection of valis during the excavation.
meanings.sent2: The valis were used by the Romans for trade and transactions.
meanings.sent3: The museum displayed the ancient valis in a special exhibit.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were like valuable valis, treasured by all who heard them.
meanings.sent5: The glint of the ancient valis caught the sunlight, mesmerizing all who saw them.

meanings.definition: A plural form of the word 'vali', referring to a type of ancient Roman weight measurement.
meanings.sent1: The merchant used valis to measure the goods he sold.
meanings.sent2: The valis were crucial for ensuring fair trade in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent3: The baker mistakenly added extra valis of flour to the recipe.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a weighty burden, like carrying valis on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The valis on the scale tipped in favor of the customer, signaling a good deal.
